DataElement.preferredName: Image Acquisition Scan Complete Hour Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time that represents the hour of the completion of the acquisition process of a medical image.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Completion of the acquisition process of a medical image. [Manually_curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which an image is acquired or obtained.

Concepts.definition: The process by which an image is acquired or obtained.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pictures of structures inside the body. Scans often used in diagnosing, staging, and monitoring disease include liver scans, bone scans, and computed tomography (CT) or computerized axial tomography (CAT) scans and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans. In liver scanning and bone scanning, radioactive substances that are injected into the bloodstream collect in these organs. A scanner that detects the radiation is used to create pictures. In CT scanning, an x-ray machine linked to a computer is used to produce detailed pictures of organs inside the body. MRI scans use a large magnet connected to a computer to create pictures of areas inside the body.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/16/08 - released for use in CDE by UofWash PET study.  3/16/07 - created to support ACRIN Breast CDE curation

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time value that represents a period of time measured in twenty-fourths of a mean solar day (format hh). [Explanatory comment:  The preferred exchange format for Hour is hh. The values for hour and numbers between 00 and 23, with 01 being 1 AM and 23 being 12 PM or midnight. The display format for Hour information is determined by programmatic requirements.]

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/11/17 jk transferred context and added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task.

DataElement.changeDescription: 7/11/17 jk CDE versioned for short/long name, definition change per Round 5 finalization task.  12/7/16 changed to Standard registration status. jk 9/25/13 added alt questions; update CSI by removing ACRIN-caBIG and pointed to appropriate ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc  6/25/13 CDE released; associated with Image Administration CRF CSI jc.  3/18/07 Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development task.
